content.text: She buys a jacket for \$40 and sells it for \$45.40
Calculate the percentage profit

Calculate the cost price
Rowena buys and sells clothes
Sara invests \$500 for 15 years at a rate of 2% per year simple interest
Calculate the total interest Sara receives

The value of this car **decreases** exponentially by \(18\%\) each year
Calculate the value of this car after 5 years
Give your answer correct to the nearest hundred dollars

Calculate the value of \(x\)

The frequency table shows the results

content.text: Jojo chooses two cards at random from Set \(A\) without replacement
Find the probability that the two cards have the same number
Jojo replaces the two cards
Kylie then chooses one card at random from Set \(A\) and one card at random from Set \(B\)
Find the probability that the two cards have the same number
Who is the most likely to choose two cards that have the same number?
Show all your working
The diagram shows two sets of cards
Lena chooses three cards at random from Set \(C\) without replacement
Find the probability that the third card chosen is numbered 4
At a football match, the price of an adult ticket is \(\$ x\) and the price of a child ticket is \(\$ (x - 2.50)\). There are 18 500 adults and 2400 children attending the football match
The total amount paid for the tickets is \$320040
Find the price of an adult ticket

\$168 from selling monthly magazines
\$207 from selling weekly magazines
The total number of these magazines sold during this day is 100

\(DE = BC = 6\mathrm{cm}.\)

\(AB = 8 \text{cm}\) , \(BC = 4 \text{cm}\) and \(CR = 5 \text{cm}\)
Water flows through a cylindrical pipe at a speed of \(8\mathrm{cm / s}\)
The radius of the circular cross-section is \(1.5\mathrm{cm}\) and the pipe is always completely full of water
Calculate the amount of water that flows through the pipe in 1 hour
Give your answer in litres
.........litres
Show that the total surface area of the cone is \(108\pi \mathrm{cm}^2\)
[The curved surface area, \(A\) , of a cone with radius \(r\) and slant height \(l\) is \(A = \pi r l\) .]
Find the value of \(x\) and the value of \(y\)
[The surface area, \(A\) , of a sphere with radius \(r\) is \(A = 4\pi r^2\) .]
x =

The base radius of the cone is \(6\mathrm{cm}\) and the slant height is \(12\mathrm{cm}\)
The radius of the sphere is \(x\mathrm{cm}\) and the radius of the hemisphere is \(y\mathrm{cm}\)
The **total** surface area of each solid is the same
For the following calculations, put a tick \((\checkmark)\) if it is possible or put a cross \((\star)\) if it is not possible. There is no need to carry out any of the calculations

Work out \(\mathbf{P}\mathbf{N}\)
